description: The company said in the latest quarter, it recorded an $8,400,000 gain from proceeds on the sale and leaseback of two DC-9-81 aircraft, two spare engines and a quick-engine- change kit. The company said proceeds were used to repay related long- term debt.

title: Toromont Industries reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: The company said the substantial increase in revenue reflected the consolidation of 51 percent-owned Enerflex Systems Ltd. in the latest 6 months, together with improved revenue from the refrigeration group. Results are in Canadian funds.

title: A SOHO CINEMA DELAYS OPENING
description: The Angelika Film Center, a new six-screen movie theater in SoHo that was to have opened today, has postponed its opening for at least a week. The opening of the $4 million center at Mercer and Houston Streets, which is to be Manhattan's only first-run, multi-screen movie theater south of Greenwich Village, has already been postponed several times because of construction delays.

title: Keystone Camera reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Included extraordinary income of $13,000 for the quarter and $224,000 for the 6 months, both from the forgiveness of accounts payable. c-Net loss

title: 'LA BOCA DEL LOBO' FROM PERU
description: ''La Boca del Lobo'' (''The Mouth of the Wolf''), Francisco J. Lombardi's Peruvian film opening today at the Public, dramatizes the no-win situation of the Peruvian Indian caught in a war in which he has no part to play except as the victim.

title: F.B.I. Chief Is Balancing On Very Slippery Track
description: In the 22 months since William S. Sessions left a Federal judgeship in Texas to head the Federal Bureau of Investigation, he has operated on a fast and treacherous track. While balancing a testy relationship with the Justice Department, he has had to answer in-house complaints of racial bigotry and criticism of the bureau's investigative conduct.

title: LGS Group Inc reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: Newark Agrees To Curb Razing Of City Housing
description: Eight rundown and mostly vacant public housing high-rises will be dynamited, perhaps starting early next year, but other demolitions have been put off under a settlement announced in a Federal court today.

title: ABS Industries reports earnings for Qtr to July 31
description: b-Included a tax credit of $131,000 for the quarter and a tax benefit of $534,000 for the 9 months. c-Included losses from discontinued operations of $98,000 and $235,000 for the quarter and 9 months, respectively, and tax benefits of $189,000 for the quarter and $254,000 for the 9 months. Year-ago share earnings were restated for a 3-for-1 split recorded in the latest second quarter.

title: Thackeray Corp reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-After a gain on disposal of discontinued operations of $6,595,000 for the quarter and 6 months; the 6 months also included a loss from discontinued operations of $1,191,000. c-Net loss and after a loss of $119,000 for the quarter and a gain of $38,000 for the 6 months, both from discontinued operations, and extraordinary charges of $147,000 and $186,000 for the quarter and 6 months, respectively. Thackeray's Lion Ribbon Co. subsidiary was sold in May 1989 and has been treated as a discontinued operation for reporting purposes.

title: Bush 'Would Encourage' Polish Shift, Aide Says
description: President Bush ''would encourage'' the formation of a non-Communist government in Poland, his spokesman said today, but the President will not say anything to ''upset the applecart.''

title: Clorox Co reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-After losses from discontinued operations of $21,960,000 and $21,416,000 for the quarter and year, respectively. c-Included net from discontinued operations of $190,000 for the quarter and $1,644,000 for the year. The company said the latest loss from discontinued operations included a reduction in the net assets held for sale to the estimated net realized value and estimates for disposition costs and operating losses during the phase-out period.

title: Westmarc Communications Inc reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: The latest periods included a $16,000 loss for the quarter and a $7,168,000 gain for the 6 months, both on the sale of assets.

title: Reflectone Inc reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
Economic Scene; The White House Vs. the Fed
description: NO Federal Reserve chairman is a hero at the White House. President Bush's budget director, Richard G. Darman, has fluttered the dovecotes from Constitution Avenue to Wall Street by maintaining that the Fed has kept interest rates so high that it was risking a recession. And he has the President's backing.

title: ACCORD IS REACHED AT BELL ATLANTIC
description: The Bell Atlantic Corporation and one of its striking unions reached tentative agreement today on the framework of a new contract. But unresolved local issues and continuing differences with another union prevented an end to a 13-day strike.

title: 3d No-Hitter for Drees
description: Despite pitching his third no-hit game of the Pacific Coast League season on Wednesday night, when the Vancouver Canadiens defeated the Las Vegas Stars, 5-0, Tom Drees will not be called up to the Chicago White Sox this season. In fact, the club has already instructed Drees, a 26-year-old left-hander, to report to the Florida Instructional League next month.

title: Recognition Equipment reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Net income c-After a charge of $3,578,000 from the cumulative effect of an accounting change for spare parts. The company said the year-ago results were restated.

title: Phone-Rate Proposal
description: The California Public Utilities Commission, in part of a nationwide trend toward telephone deregulation, today proposed loosening controls on local telephone rates in the state.

title: JARUZELSKI CONSIDERS MOVE
description: Solidarity appeared on the verge of forming a Government today after the Communist Prime Minister resigned and President Wojciech Jaruzelski announced that he would ''urgently consider'' a proposal for a Solidarity-led cabinet.

title: Wilshire Oil Co of Texas reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
LARGEST COAL USER CRITICIZES BUSH'S ACID RAIN PROPOSAL
description: The nation's largest user of coal said yesterday that President Bush's acid rain proposal could wreck the American economy, and contended that it was ''one of the harshest, least flexible and most costly bills ever introduced in the Congress.''

title: IN 'CASUALTIES OF WAR,' GROUP LOYALTY VS. INDIVIDUAL CONSCIENCE
description: ''We're going to requisition a girl for a little portable R. & R.,'' Sergeant Meserve tells the four members of his squad at the end of a briefing.

title: INSIDE
description: Clues in Trident Failure

title: Imreg Inc reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Net loss

title: SENEGAL'S BAABA MAAL AND BAND
description: Most Americans got their first exposure to Senegalese rock through Youssou N'Dour, the singer and band leader whose recent music has turned westward. One of his main Senegalese rivals, the singer Baaba Maal, brought his 10-piece band, Dande Lenol (the Voice of the Race) to S.O.B.'s this week, giving New Yorkers a chance to hear less internationalized Senegalese rock -and to see the leaping acrobatic dances - from both band and audience members - that go with it.

title: Kaprielian Acquired
description: Kaprielian O'Leary Advertising, a tiny New York agency whose clients include the Cayman Islands Department of Tourism, has been acquired by the Gegenheimer Group, a New York company whose other agency holding is Hyers/Smith in South Norwalk, Conn.

title: Collins Industries reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Included tax credits of $229,000 and $507,000 for the quarter and 9 months, respectively. c-Net loss d-Included a gain of $351,000 for the quarter and a loss of $1,572,000 for the 9 months, both from discontinued operations.

title: Cambridge Analytical Assocites Inc reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Net income and included tax credits of $39,000 and $46,500 for the quarter and 6 months, respectively.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: ''Today we are witnessing a turning point in the battle to change AIDS from a fatal disease to a treatable one.'' - Dr. Louis W. Sullivan, Secretary of Health and Human Services. [ A1:1. ]

title: New York City Pulls $3 Billion From Irving Trust
description: New York City will no longer use the Irving Trust Company as custodian of $3 billion in short-term funds held by the city and its five pension funds because the bank cannot meet deadlines for submitting a plan to insure equal employment opportunity, Comptroller Harrison J. Goldin announced yesterday.

title: Dicon Systems Ltd.  reports earnings for Year to June 30
description: b-Net income The company said it had a write-off in the latest year of a sufficient size to explain the entire loss. Results are in Candian dollars.

title: Compudyne Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Included a loss of $47,000 and a net of $4,000 for the quarter and 6 months, respectively, both from disposal of discontinued operations. c-Included a loss of $273,000 for the quarter and net of $98,000 for the 6 months, both from disposal of discontinued operations, and the 6 months also included net from discontinued operations of $28,000.

title: In Cambodia, a Deepening Fear Of a New Khmer Rouge Regime
description: It is a measure of the uncertainty about the future here that officials in the Government and ruling party have drawn up contingency plans for underground resistance should the Khmer Rouge succeed in returning to power in Cambodia, senior diplomats say.

title: 4,000 Gazans Shun Jobs for a Day As Israeli Permits Are Introduced
description: The Israeli Army today officially put into effect a policy requiring Gaza Strip workers to show a new exit permit if they want to enter Israel from Gaza. But instead, many Palestinians stayed home.

title: Traffic Alert
description: Because of the Harlem Week celebration, 125th Street between Adam Clayton Powell Jr. Boulevard and Fifth Avenue will be closed today from 11 A.M. to 11.30 P.M. and tomorrow from 8 A.M. to 10 P.M. between St. Nicholas Avenue and Fifth Avenue Because of the India Day Parade, Madison Avenue between 23d and 26th Streets will be closed tomorrow from noon to 9 P.M. The avenue between 28th and 57th Streets will be closed from noon to 3 P.M.

title: Ethiopia Minister Says Civil War Cost Is High
description: Announcing his Government's agreement to attend peace talks with Eritrean rebels in Atlanta, Ethiopia's Foreign Minister acknowledged today that the long-running civil conflict had cost his country dearly.

title: Chartwell Group reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
Campaign Trail; Is a Broadside Breslin's? No Comment
description: As is common at such times, the campaign literature accumulating in mailboxes and underfoot in New York City conforms to a rather restrictive genre. Essentially, the leaflets that are spreading like losing parimutel tickets at a racetrack all proclaim as stridently as possible that somebody's guy is better than the other guys. But this morning's appearance of The Eldridge Independent signaled a possible new departure.

title: Help on H.U.D. Applications Not Improper
description: To the Editor:

title: Prime Motor Inns L.P. reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: The 1988 results have been restated as a result of increased depreciation due to a change in useful lives of property and equipment. Share earnings are in units.

title: American Pacesetter reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Net income c-After losses from spun-off operations of $1,148,000 for the quarter and $516,000 for the 6 months. Latest second quarter results included a $279,000 loss on sales of loans, compared with a $552,000 gain on sales of loans during the second quarter of 1988. The company said the 1989 period loss was due primarily to a $361,000 write-off of deferred loan sale premiums that occurred when the company adjusted its cumulative amortization to reflect a faster actual loan payoff than was originally estimated. The company is listed on the Pacific Stock Exchange.

title: Karen Van Dyck Weds in Greece
description: Karen Rhoads Van Dyck and Nelson J. Moe, graduates of Wesleyan University, were married yesterday at Ayios Lavrendis, a church in Pelion, Greece. The bride's father, the Rev. Dr. Nicholas B. Van Dyck, a Presbyterian minister, performed the ceremony.

title: Steinbrenner Does It Again: Green Out, Dent In
description: George Steinbrenner, saying his mushrooming differences with Dallas Green had become personal, today made the 17th managerial change in his 17 seasons as owner of the Yankees. Steinbrenner dismissed Green and replaced him with Bucky Dent, the man who will forever live in Yankee history for the playoff home run he hit in 1978.

title: Books of The Times; Refueling the Elgin Marbles Debate
description: Imperial Spoils The Curious Case of the Elgin Marbles By Christopher Hitchens 137 pages. Illustrated. Hill & Wang. $19.95.

title: Except for Music, Mozart Was Ordinary
description: To the Editor:

title: American Exploration Co.  reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Net loss

title: Le Thanh Nghi, Vietnamese Official, 78
description: Le Thanh Nghi, former Vice President of Vietnam, died on Wednesday of old age and illness, the Hanoi radio reported today. He was 78 years old.

title: Police Are Unjustly Accused of Excessive Force in Thorpe Case
description: To the Editor:

title: Artopex International reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Net loss Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: NEWS SUMMARY
description: INTERNATIONAL 2-5 A Solidarity official will be named Poland's Prime Minister, the official said. He is Tadeusz Mazowiecki, expected to be named today as the first non-Communist head of government in Eastern Europe since the early postwar years. Page 1

title: Canseco's Plea Bargain
description: Jose Canseco, the Oakland Athletics outfielder, plans to plead no contest to a misdemeanor weapons violation in exchange for probation and community service, his attorney said yesterday.

title: U.S. PLANS TO WAIT ON NEW POLISH AID
description: The White House spokesman said today that it was ''premature'' to talk about sending additional aid to Poland to bolster a new non-Communist government, but added that the United States would ''increase aid as appropriate and as we can.''

title: INSIDE
description: Colombian Politician Slain

title: Pistons Make Offer To Hawks' Koncak
description: Since losing Rick Mahorn in the expansion draft, the Detroit Pistons have been seeking a starting power forward. Since the Pistons won the National Basketball Association championship in June, Jon Koncak, a 7-foot forward with the Atlanta Hawks, has been seeking a new contract, as a restricted free agent. So it was no wonder that the Pistons offered Koncak a one-year deal. What was shocking, though, was the size of the offer: approximately $2.5 million, according to a report yesterday in The Atlanta Constitution.

title: Cummins Job Cuts
description: The Cummins Engine Company said it would lay off about 100 production workers in southern Indiana, effective Aug. 28, because of slower industry orders for heavy-duty truck engines and because of production adjustments by some important Cummins truck customers. Cummins Engine shares closed today at $60.625, down $1.375, on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Academic Reward System Works Just Fine; No 'Salami Sandwiches'
description: To the Editor:

title: Coping: With Long-Distance Telephone Rates
description: In a battle for residential customers, the nation's three major long-distance telephone companies - American Telephone and Telegraph, MCI and U S Sprint - have introduced a variety of discount calling plans. Each can mean considerable savings for individual customers.

title: Ivax Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Net income The company said the latest quarter and 6 months results are restated to give retroactive effect to the merger with Best Generics Inc. and Sus Chemcial Co.

title: Eva Marton Cancels at Met Opera
description: Eva Marton has canceled all her appearances at the Metropolitan Opera for the 1989-90 season, the Met and Miss Marton's representatives announced yesterday. The Hungarian soprano was to have sung Senta in a new production of Wagner's ''Fliegende Hollander'' and the Empress in a major revival of ''Die Frau Ohne Schatten,'' by Richard Strauss.

title: Palestinians' Lawyers to End Army-Court Boycott
description: Palestinian lawyers and a few of their Jewish colleagues say they will end a monthlong boycott of Israeli military courts on Sunday, acknowledging that the action has not succeeded in doing much to change the conditions that brought about their strike on behalf of Palestinian prisoners.

title: POSTWAR MILESTONE IN BLOC
description: A senior Solidarity official said today that he would be nominated as Poland's Prime Minister. He would be the first non-Communist head of government in Eastern Europe since the early postwar years.

title: Academic Reward System Works Just Fine; Prolific Darwin
description: To the Editor:

title: The Travers Is Easy Goer's Race
description: Greatness can be boring if you're trying to pick winners at the race track. Consider the 120th Travers Stakes today at Saratoga Race Track.

title: Review/Film; A Racing Addict's Dream Comes True: One More Win
description: Early in ''Let It Ride,'' Joe Pytka's comedy about the world of horse racing, a teen-age girl in a bar accidentally catches a necklace between the braces in her teeth. ''Who's her orthodontist, Ray Charles?'' someone remarks. That sort of wisecrack is what passes for humor in the movie, which stars Richard Dreyfuss as a horse-racing addict who begs God for one big win before giving up gambling and has his prayers answered.

title: Investigation Chief Says License Was Suspended
description: New York City's Commissioner of Investigation, Kevin B. Frawley, acknowledged yesterday that he drove his car for more than two years with a suspended license, but said he had been unaware of the suspension.

title: COMPANY BRIEFS
description: * Abitibi-Price Inc., Toronto, said it had reached an agreement with North British Newsprint Ltd, a holdings company, that gives it exclusive rights to take over the North British newsprint project at Gartcosh, Scotland.

title: Tank Battles Push Beirut War to North
description: Artillery barrages killed 4 people and wounded 12 in Beirut overnight, and Syrian forces and Christian units of the Lebanese Army fought tank battles today to the north of the city, across a strategic bridge overlooking the Mediterranean.

title: Lori Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-After income from discontinued operations of $1,275,000 for the both the quarter and 6 months. c-Net loss d-Included losses from discontinued operations of $4,414,000 and $4,724,000 for the quarter and 6 months, respectively, and extraordinary credits of $94,000 for the quarter and $122,000 for the 6 months. Year-ago quarter and 6-month loss from discontinued operations included a $3.6 million net charge due to accounting irregularities.

title: MICC Investments reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-After a special gain of $1.2 million. c-After special gains of $6.3 million and $12.9 million for the quarter and 6 months, respectively. Results are in Canadian funds.

title: ARGENTINA AGREES ON TALKS TO RENEW TIES WITH BRITAIN
description: Britain and Argentina agreed today to set aside their rival claims over the Falkland Islands and start substantive talks on restoring diplomatic relations, which were severed at the start of their war for control of the bleak, windswept South Atlantic islands in 1982.

title: Tribune/Swab-Fox Cos. reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Net income Share earnings in each year-ago period were less than 1 cent a share.

title: Starr Smerek Wed To N. R. Furlotte
description: Starr Ann Smerek and Nicolas Robert Furlotte were married yesterday at the Holy Redeemer Roman Catholic Church in Bar Harbor, Me., by the Rev. C. James Martel.

title: Quebec Signs Mylnikov
description: The Quebec Nordiques announced the signing yesterday of Sergei Mylnikov to a one-year contract with a one-year option. The 30-year-old Mylnikov will become the first Soviet goaltender to play in the National Hockey League. Financial details were not released, but Martin Madden, the Nordiques' general manager, said Mylnikov would receive half his salary. The remainder will go to Soviet sports authorities.(AP)

title: Soviets Confirm Nazi Pacts Dividing Europe
description: After decades of denial, the Kremlin conceded for the first time today that ''without a doubt'' the Soviet Union and Nazi Germany secretly and illegally divided Eastern Europe into spheres of influence before the start of World War II.

title: Management Co. Entertainent Group reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Net income The company said the latest loss is primarily due to certain accounting treatments related to its acquisition of Virgin Vision in July and recognition of certain costs involved in completing the transaction.

title: Bradley REIT reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: Revenue represents rental income.

title: Black Hawk Holdings reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
Cold Calm on Tape of a Doomed Flight
description: Cold calm pervaded the terse exchanges between a 27-year-old air traffic controller and a pilot fighting to land his crippled DC-10 jetliner last month in Sioux City, Iowa, a recording of their conversations shows.

title: More Police Are Proposed For Subways
description: Citing a sharp rise in subway crime, three Transit Authority board members startled colleagues at a board meeting yesterday by arguing that the agency should not be bound by city-ordered budget cuts in the transit police and should instead consider using its own money to hire more officers.

title: Home Federal Savings Bank (Indiana) reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Net loss Prior year per share earnings are not available because the bank converted from a mutual institution to a stock holding institution in January 1988.

title: New York Area Has 0.1% Rise
description: The Consumer Price Index for the New York metropolitan area rose by one-tenth of 1 percent in July, a negligible increase, the Labor Department's regional Bureau of Labor Statistics in New York City reported yesterday.

title: MAI Basic Gets Aid Infusion
description: MAI Basic Four Inc., in need of resuscitation after spending millions in a failed effort to acquire a competitor, said today that it had agreed to receive a $55 million infusion from an investor group led by MAI's chairman, the financier Bennett S. LeBow.

title: Review/Music; 'Dido and Aeneas' of 1689 and Today
description: It would seem an odd idea to base an opera production on the circumstances of its first performance, but Eric Fraad and Christopher Alden -producer and director of Opera at the Academy's ''Dido and Aeneas'' on Lafayette Street - have, by a kind of interpretive implosion, taken a universal masterpiece and managed to squeeze it back into the bottle in which it originated.

title: Crown Andersen reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-After losses from discontinued operations of $2,359,133 for the quarter and $2,606,971 for the 9 months. c-Net income and included a gain of $23,788 for the quarter and a loss of $113,494 for the 9 months, both from discontinued operations.

title: Pace Membership Warehouse reports earnings for Qtr to July 16
description: b-After an extraordinary loss of $18,000 for the quarter and an extraordinary credit of $65,000 for the 6 months, both from the repurchase of debt. c-After extraordinary tax credits of $714,000, or 6 cents a share, for the quarter and $950,000, or 7 cents a share, for the 6 months.

title: Automatic Data Processing Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: The company said in the latest fourth quarter, it sold its automated teller and real estate service businesses for about $95 million, resulting in a pretax gain of about $66 million. These dispositions will not have a material effect on the company's ongoing earnings.

title: Malartic Hygrade Gold Mines (Canada) Ltd.(A) reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: Results are in Canadian funds.

title: IPCO Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Included losses from discontinued operations of $14,234,000 and $18,631,000 for the quarter and year, respectively. c-After losses from discontinued operations of $1,883,000 for the quarter and $3,039,000 for the year. The 1989 fourth quarter and year losses from discontinued operations included a loss of $13,293,000 on disposal of the company's unprofitable medical group's operations.

title: Bigger and Stretchier Sheets For Those New Fat Mattresses
description: Mattress manufacturers met with sheet makers this month to solve a problem that has been giving consumers sleepless nights: skimpy sheets.

title: Akorn Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-After a charge of $90,822 from the settlement of escrow for both the quarter and year. c-After a loss of $26,348 for the quarter and a gain of $5,453,788 for the year, both from the sale of an affiliate.

title: A New Jersey Race, With Resonance
description: While most New Jerseyans have been enjoying the shore or swatting mosquitoes, the two men who would be their governor have been refining their messages. The contest offers a sharp contrast in philosophies. And it's already shown that the U.S. Supreme Court has made abortion a central issue in state politics.

title: Detroit Spoils Dent's Debut
description: Meeting with the players before his first game as manager of the Yankees, Bucky Dent, sounding like Yogi Berra, told them tonight, ''You're not out of it till you're out of it.''

title: Transactions
description: Baseball

title: Conservators Named for de Kooning Assets
description: Willem de Kooning's daughter, Lisa, and his longtime lawyer, John L. Eastman, were named today the conservators of the ailing painter's assets by a Long Island court.

title: PLM Equipment Growth Fund I L.P. reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: Share earnings are in units.

title: British Cite Lower Inflation
description: Britain today announced the first fall in inflation in 19 months, suggesting that the rise in the cost of living had peaked and would soon slow down.

title: Gwil Industries reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Included net from discontinued operations of $377,000 and $615,000 for the quarter and 6 months, respectively, and a special gain of $2,367,000 for both the quarter and 6 months. Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: Bridge
description: The most prolific bridge writer in the world is no doubt Hugh Kelsey of Scotland, who has produced about 30 high-quality books in 22 years. His latest is ''Improve Your Partner's Defence,'' available for $19.45 including postage from Barclay Bridge Supplies, 8 Bush Avenue, Port Chester N.Y. 10573.

title: Parral Journal; A Labor Leader and His Dusty Exile
description: Manuel Bustos, one of Chile's leading labor leaders, is living in political exile here, a sentence that confines him day and night to this provincial town of 38,000 people.

title: Mets and Cone Win on Hershiser's Wild Pitch
description: The names on the marquee this time were Orel Hershiser and David Cone, meeting in a revival of their classics of 1988 and pitching almost to a standoff for eight bristling innings last night in Shea Stadium. One pitch came between them: one wild pitch, bounced by Hershiser in the sixth inning and cashed by the Mets into the deciding run and a 3-2 victory over the Los Angeles Dodgers.

title: Sizeler Property Investors reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
Law Has Koch Conducting Threadbare Field Operation
description: The small second-floor suite of offices looks more like the headquarters of an also-ran than of a three-term incumbent who has amassed some of the largest victory margins in New York City history.

title: U.S. Order Jolts Stocks Of Catheter Companies
description: A Food and Drug Administraton decision to order C.R. Bard Inc. to halt shipment of a catheter caused sharp movements today in the stock of Bard and a principal competitor, Sci-Med Life Systems, Bard's shares fell $1.50, to $20, on the New York Stock Exchange, with more than two million shares trading. It was the third-most-active Big Board stock. Sci-Med's shares surged nearly 34 percent, rising $12.125, to $48.125, in over-the-counter trading, where it was the day's leading percentage gainer. More than one million Sci-Med shares traded.

title: Isosceles Truce With Newgateway
description: Isosceles P.L.C. said it had reached a truce with Newgateway P.L.C,, the company it defeated last month in a battle for majority control of the British supermarket operator the Gateway Corporation, Newgateway still has a 40 percent holding in Gateway. Newgateway includes the American investment firm Wasserstein, Perella & Co. and the Great Atlantic and Pacific Tea Company. Newgateway will exchange its holding for a proportionate stake in Isosceles and it will have representation on Gateway's board of directors, and will support Isosceles in carrying out ''its commercial strategy.''

title: Group Victoire Bidder Lifts Offer
description: Compagnie Financiere de Suez raised its offer for the insurer Groupe Victoire in a bid to win official clearance for France's biggest hostile takeover bid. Compagnie Financiere, a financial services giant, had undervalued Victoire, France's second-largest insurer, in its initial bid.

title: Celtics Sign Pinckney
description: The Boston Celtics announced yesterday that they had signed Ed Pinckney, a 6-9 forward, to a multiyear contract. No terms were disclosed. Pinckney, who averaged 10.1 points and 5.1 rebounds in 29 games for Boston, came to the Celtics with Joe Kleine in a trade on Feb. 23 that sent Danny Ainge and Brad Lohaus to the Sacramento Kings.(AP)

title: Outsider, Insider, They All Go
description: So much for the theory about strong-willed cusses from outside the organization.

title: Jan Bell Stake
description: Craig Dill Capital L.P., a New York investment limited partnership, has acquired a 5.08 percent stake in Jan Bell Marketing Inc., the jewelry designer and manufacturer based in Sunrise, Fla., In a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission, Craig said that it had purchased the Jan Bell shares for investment purposes only. The partnership acquired its Jan Bell shares on the open market for an average price of $14.16 a share. Shares of Jan Bell rose $1.75, to $23.25, in trading on the American Stock Exchange. At that price the company's current market value would be $448 million.

title: Patents; Using Flax To Get Benefit Of Fish Oils
description: Paul A. Stitt, a Wisconsin biochemist-turned-baker, this week patented what he said is a way to put the health benefits of cod-liver oil - without its notoriously foul taste - into bread, cookies, salad dressings and even fruit drinks.

title: Cuomo Vows to Add State Drug Troopers
description: Addressing a graduating class of the New York State Police Academy, Gov. Mario M. Cuomo said today that he would seek money in next year's budget to add 150 troopers to the state police narcotics squad.

title: Hormel (Geo. A.) & Co.  (A) reports earnings for Qtr to July 29
description: The company said Jennie-O Foods Inc. contributed positively to the third quarter while FDL Marketing Inc. produced negative results because of a combination of increased pork price levels and an inability to provide satisfactory margins.

title: Priam Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Net income

title: Corcap reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Included a loss of $47,000 for the quarter and a gain of $4,000 for the 6 months, both from disposal of discontinued operations. c-Included a loss of $273,000 and income of $28,000 for the quarter and 6 months, respectively, both from discontinued operations, and the 6 months also included a gain on disposal of discontinued operations of $98,000.

title: Equipment Co. of America reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Included an extraordinary loss of $23,000 for the quarter and an extraordinary credit of $3,000 for the 6 months. c-Net income d-Included extraordinary credits of $39,000 and $64,000 for the quarter and 6 months, respectively. Latest 6-month share earnings was less than one cent a share.

title: Julius Schapira, 87, Insurance-Law Expert
description: Julius L. Schapira, a lawyer who specialized in court appeals and was of counsel to the Manhattan firm of Greenberg, Cantor, Trager & Toplitz, died of pneumonia Wednesday at Lenox Hill Hospital. He was 87 years old and lived in Manhattan.

title: United Coasts Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
Review/Theater; Saint Joan and Her Inner Voices
description: George Bernard Shaw never let a show stand in the way of social comment and, more often than not, put the two together in witty theatrical exegesis.

title: Some Gains Reported In Two Phone Regions
description: Progress was reported yesterday in talks between striking unions and two regional Bell telephone companies, the Bell Atlantic Corporation and the Pacific Telesis Group. But none was reported at the Ameritech corporation, which serves five Midwestern states, or at the New England Telephone Company.

title: Hearing Set for Rose Suit
description: Judge John D. Holschuh today set Aug. 28 for the start of the hearing on Pete Rose's request for a preliminary injunction that would continue to block his appearance before A. Bartlett Giamatti, the baseball commissioner, on gambling accusations.

title: Major Changes for Health System Seen After Reports on AIDS Drug
description: The finding that most of the million or more Americans thought to be infected with the AIDS virus can benefit from taking the drug AZT is likely to have major consequences for the health-care system, possibly adding hundreds of thousands of new patients and billions of dollars in new costs at one stroke.

title: The Sleeper of Securities Firms
description: Not long ago, Dean Witter Reynolds Inc. was ridiculed as the ''stocks and socks'' brokerage owned by Sears, Roebuck & Company. But now the tables have turned.

title: Schultz Sav-O Stores Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to July 15
description: b-After gains on inventory accounting adjustments net of LIFO charges of $96,000, or 3 cents a share, for the quarter and $190,000, or 7 cents a share, for the 6 months.

title: Federal Industries reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: McMahon Sent to Chargers In Exchange for Draft Pick
description: Jim McMahon, who led the Chicago Bears to a Super Bowl victory in the 1985 season before falling out of favor with Coach Mike Ditka, was traded to the San Diego Chargers today for a conditional 1990 draft choice.

title: Zero Fraud - Only With Zero Science
description: LEAD: Are scientists in general trying to conceal fraud? Absolutely not.

title: Film Festival's Year of the Epic
description: Epic-sized films and documentaries will dominate the 27th New York Film Festival, which opens Sept. 22 at Lincoln Center with Bertrand Blier's ''Too Beautiful for You'' and concludes Oct. 9 with Bill Forsyth's ''Breaking In.''

title: Nostalgia Network Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
Interfund Corp.  reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
TV Film on Trump Can't Find a Station
description: A two-hour television documentary about Donald Trump financed by a longtime rival in the real-estate business has run into problems even before it is finished.

title: Lessard Beaucage Lemieus reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: Two Officials Penalized
description: The National Hockey League has penalized two officials for what it termed violation of curfew regulations in the recent playoffs. Jim Gregory, the league's vice president of hockey operations, announced yesterday that Don Koharski, a referee, and Wayne Bonney, a linesman, would be fined $1,000 each and assigned to either the American or International Hockey Leagues for a period of two weeks, or seven games, at the beginning of the upcoming season.

title: Cavco Industries reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
Patents; A Sweetened Cereal With Fewer Calories
description: Nabisco Brands, the baked goods unit of RJR Nabisco Inc., has teamed with a biotechnology company to develop a naturally sweetened cereal that has fewer calories than today's sugar-coated offerings.

title: Minivans' Popularity Prompts Bid to End Safety Exemptions
description: Minivans have been replacing the family station wagon in recent years. The vehicles ride and handle like cars, but are more comfortable and roomy. This year, when annual sales of the vehicles, at $13,000 to $20,000, are expected to top one million, there is growing public and Congressional concern about their safety.

title: Bestar Inc.  reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: Security Financial Group reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
A Van Cliburn Contest To Be Broadcast on FM
description: An 18-part series devoted to the recent Eighth International Van Cliburn Piano Competition is to be broadcast on WFUV radio, 90.7 FM, on the first two Tuesdays of each month through June 1990; the series will begin on Oct. 3 at 7 P.M. Bruce Posner and Joe Patrych, who attended the contest in Fort Worth in June, are to be the hosts.

title: American Ecology reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Included losses from discontinued operations of $2,465,000 and $2,624,000 for the quarter and 6 months, respectively. c-After income from discontinued operations of $200,000 and $386,000 for the quarter and 6 months, respectively, and the 6 months also included income of $575,000 from an accounting change. The company said the year-ago quarter and 6 months both included a $3,927 provision for the settlement of a $97 million suit filed by the State of Illinois in 1978.

title: Consolidated Stores Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to July 29
description: b-Net income Latest quarter share earnings was less than one cent a share.

title: Corrections
description: An article on Aug. 10 about Gibraltarians' attitudes toward Spain and Britain described the status of Hong Kong residents imprecisely. Some 3.25 million Hong Kong Chinese are eligible for passports that declare them citizens of the British dependent territory, but they have not been granted the right to settle in Britain after the colony reverts to China in 1997.

description: b-Included tax credits of $285,000 and $720,000 for the quarter and 6 months, respectively. c-Included tax credits of $870,000 for the quarter and $1,610,000 for the 6 months. Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: Giuliani Campaign Tries to Overcome Stumbling Start
description: Rudolph W. Giuliani's mayoral campaign has been nagged by organizational problems, fund-raising failings and missteps by the former prosecutor that have made his road as a candidate anything but the smooth path that was anticipated three months ago.

title: Etz Lavud Ltd.  reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Net income Results are in U.S. currency.

title: Elsie M. Murphy, 81; Ran Textile Company
description: Elsie M. Murphy, a former president of S. Stroock & Company, manufacturers of woolen goods in Newburgh, N.Y., died Tuesday at Good Samaritan Hospital in Suffern, N.Y. She was 81 years old and lived in Spring Valley, N.Y.

title: Information On AIDS Tests
description: Several organizations provide confidential information about AIDS and tests for the disease. Among such services in the New York area are these: Gay Men's Health Crisis AIDS Hotline: (212) 807-6655; staffed from 10:30 A.M. to 9 P.M., Monday through Friday, and noon to 3 P.M. on Saturday. New York City AIDS Hotline: (718) 485-8111; staffed from 9 A.M. to 9 P.M., every day. National AIDS Hotline: (800) 342-2437; staffed 24 hours a day, every day. In southwestern Connecticut: Greater Bridgeport AIDS Hotline: (203) 336-2437; answering machine. In New Jersey: New Jersey AIDS Hotline: (800) 624-2377.

title: U.S. Gold Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
Help on H.U.D. Applications Not Improper; Praise for Murphy
description: To the Editor:

title: Repairing a Leaky Hose
description: If your old garden hose is cracked and leaking and beyond repair, look for a rubber or rubber-vinyl one to replace it. They are more durable than those made of unreinforced vinyl. Fifty feet is a minimal length; 100 feet is more practical.

title: Canadian Manoir Industries Ltd.  reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-After special gains of $94,000 and $196,000 for the quarter and 6 months, respectively. Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: Astros Trade Hatcher
description: The Houston Astros traded Billy Hatcher to the Pittsburgh Pirates for Glenn Wilson last night in a swap of outfielders. Wilson, 30, has nine home runs and 48 runs batted in and was hitting .282 for the Pirates. Hatcher, 28, has three homers and 34 r.b.i. and was batting .226.(AP)

title: Unisys Plans An Overhaul And Job Cuts
description: Faced with slowing growth in the computer industry, the Unisys Corporation backed away yesterday from its ambitious goals, saying it would instead reorganize its operations and reduce its work force by as much as 7 or 8 percent by the end of next year.

title: Computer Factory Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
Atlanta Mayoral Race Is Heating Up
description: Hosea L. Williams, the outspoken and irrepressible City Council member who entered the mayoral race this week, is bound to enliven the campaign, but he is unlikely to cut into the overwhelming lead of former Mayor Maynard H. Jackson, many political analysts said.

title: A City Where All Can Live
description: LEAD: Fifteen years ago, I was having a cup of coffee in Woodlawn, on Chicago's southside, with Art Brazier, a well-known activist in the Midwest who later established himself as an expert on urban America. Woodlawn was once lovely, but by 1970 much of its housing was dilapidated, its main business artery had become ''Sin Street'' and its people were dispirited.

title: CPT Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: The company said the latest quarter and year included restructuring provisions of $1,315,000 and $25,878,000, respectively, and the year-ago quarter and year included restructuring provisions of $4,145,000 and $18,985,000, respectively. Year-ago quarter included a $66,000 gain on repurchase of debentures, and a gain of $2,123,000 from such repurchases for the prior year.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: ''There have been several historic moments that have demonstrated that Poles can strive for new solutions, unusual ones, and truly innovative ones, and that we can get somewhere. I hope that such a moment even now, psychologically, is nearing.'' - Tadeusz Mazowiecki, Solidarity official expected to become Poland's next prime minister. [ 4:4. ]

title: Profit Systems Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: The company said latest quarter and 6 months included a $786,000 pre- tax charge for restructuring.

title: The Myth of the Soviet 'Killer' Laser
description: The Defense Department has for years argued that the Soviet Union is way ahead in the development of ground-based lasers that can knock out satellites.

title: Cuban Pianist and Band Refused Visas by U.S.
description: The closing concert of the Public Theater's Festival Latino, to be held Monday at the Delacorte Theater in Central Park, will be unable to present a Cuban pianist, Gonzalo Rubalcaba, and his band, Grupo Proyecto, because the State Department denied the group visas to enter the United States.

title: Sanivan Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: Results are in Canadian funds.

description: b-After an extraordinary gain of $2.1 million from early retirement of debt and a prepayment penalty of $307,000.

title: Old Spaghetti Warehouse reports earnings for Qtr to July 31
Merger Creates Radio Network
description: Two of the nation's largest radio network companies have merged to form the second-largest network in the country, officials of the new company said yesterday.

title: Deaver Prosecutor, Ending Case, Assails Ethics Act
description: The special prosecutor who investigated allegations against Michael K. Deaver, a former aide to President Ronald Reagan, said today that ''exceptions and loopholes'' in the Ethics in Government Act made it difficult to bring charges.

title: About New York; Eric, 13, Adapts To Summer Days In East Harlem
description: Eric Allen is 13 years old. He lives in a housing project in East Harlem. This is the story of his summer in New York.

title: Property Capital Trust reports earnings for Qtr to July 31
description: The latest periods' figures included gains of $540,000 for the quarter and $4.1 million for the year, both from the sale of investments. The prior year included a gain of $3.8 million from sale of investments.

title: Air Force Contract For Apple
description: Apple Computer Inc. has been awarded a contract to supply the Air Force with at least 10,000 Macintosh computers, and possibly many more, configured to run on the Unix operating system, industry people said today.

title: Patents; Patent Dispute Widens On Laser Eye Surgery
description: A bitter patent feud over a promising new laser technology to correct eye problems widened this week.

title: Blue Jays Roll Over Orioles
description: Mauro Gozzo earned his third victory in as many major-league starts and George Bell, Mookie Wilson and Lee Mazzilli each hit home runs tonight as the Toronto Blue Jays beat the Baltimore Orioles, 9-2. In 20 innings Gozzo has yielded only three earned runs.

title: Cato Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Included pretax reserves for relocation of the firm's buying office of $139,000 and $1,300,000 for the quarter and 6 months, respectively. c-Net loss and included losses from discontinued operations of $255,000 for the quarter and $337,000 for the 6 months.

title: MAN IN THE NEWS: Tadeusz Mazowiecki; A Catholic at the Helm
description: Tadeusz Mazowiecki, who is expected to be nominated for the post of Prime Minister on Saturday, is a prominent Roman Catholic layman whose appointment underscores the influential role of the church in Poland's political affairs.

title: Kindness Restores Afghan Warrior
description: Sherin Khan still cannot smile, but he can laugh and he can eat. And slowly he is learning to talk again.

title: Tierco Group reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: Results for the latest periods included the operations of the hotel and marina acquired in 1988.

description: Results are in Canadian funds.

title: California Microwave reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
Barrios Sets World Record In Men's 10,000 Meters
description: Arturo Barrios of Mexico, setting a blistering pace early, smashed the men's 10,000-meter world record with a time of 27 minutes 8.23 seconds at the Mobil grand prix track and field meet today.

title: Your Money; Family Business: A Generation Gap
description: To the person who has developed and nurtured it, a family-owned business is usually far more than a source of income. It's his baby. And he hopes his children will carry on the family tradition, but they are often attracted to other vocations.

title: House Panel Leader Jeered by Elderly in Chicago
description: Representative Dan Rostenkowski of Illinois, one of the most powerful members of Congress, was booed and followed down the street by a group of screaming elderly people Thursday as he left a meeting with community leaders opposed to his stance on a program intended to protect the elderly from the high costs of extended illnesses.

title: Haley Industries reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: Lloyd's Case Acquittal
description: Ian Posgate, a former leading insurance underwriter with Lloyd's of London, was acquitted on Thursday of conspiracy to steal $60 million of insurance money to buy a stake in a Swiss bank. The 1982 case had threatened the 300-year-old reputation of Lloyd's.

title: 2 Women in a Helicopter Free 2 Convicts, but All Are Caught
description: Two women hijacked a helicopter at gunpoint today, spirited two convicts out of a prison yard and flew to a waiting van they used to escape this region, but all four were captured after a shootout in Nebraska, the authorities said.

title: Navy Contract Is Won by G.E.
description: The General Electric Company said it had been selected by the Navy to provide all the F404-GE-400 turbofan engines for fiscal year 1990 with options to supply the needs for FA-18 aircraft production for the six fiscal years beginning in 1991. The contract could be worth as much as $2 billion, the company said.

title: Academic Reward System Works Just Fine
description: To the Editor:

title: Seward Brisbane, Executive, 74
description: Seward Brisbane, a real-estate executive in Manhattan, died of respiratory failure Thursday at his home in Upper Brookville, L.I. He was 74 years old.

description: b-Net loss c-Net income

title: Sensormatic Canada reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: Results are in Canadian funds.

title: Review/Pop; A Show Trying to Follow In 'Chorus Line's' Steps
description: ''A Hot Minute,'' the new pop revue at the Bottom Line (15 West Fourth Street), is a work-in-progress that aspires to be the music business's answer to ''A Chorus Line.'' But instead of Broadway dancers, its protagonists are studio-backup singers who have gathered for a rehearsal in a rock club.

title: A Ski Maker's Drive to Be in Front
description: In the early 1980's, the downhill skiing industry was growing quickly in the United States. But the K2 Corporation, a top American ski maker, was slumping. Almost a decade later, the tables have turned. Industry growth has slowed, but K2 is expanding quickly and now hopes to challenge its French rival, Rossignol, for the No. 1 spot in American ski sales.

title: C. Eugene Morris, 75, Former Pace U. Dean
description: Dr. C. Eugene Morris, a former dean of students at Pace University, died Wednesday at his home in Albany, after a long illess. He was 75 years old.

title: Corrections
description: Because of an editing error, an article and a picture caption on the Education page on Aug. 9 about college-bound immigrants referred incorrectly to the program Opportunity to Learn. It is not bilingual; it helps students prepare for college by teaching them in English only.

title: Plans to Replace Spofford Approved Despite Protests
description: A plan to replace the much-criticized Spofford Juvenile Center in the South Bronx with two new detention centers, one in the Bronx and the other in Brooklyn, was approved a few hours before dawn yesterday by the New York City Board of Estimate.

title: A Beethoven Festival In an Outdoor Setting
description: The 10th annual Friends of the Arts Beethoven Festival is to be held Sept. 8 through 10 at the Planting Fields Arboretum in Oyster Bay, L.I.

title: Airliner, Missing Engine Part, Returns Safely to St. Louis
description: A Trans World Airlines MD-80 airliner landed safely at Lambert St. Louis International Airport today after an engine came apart on takeoff and a two-foot piece of it narrowly missed a man on the ground.

title: Charles Lee Reese Jr., Newspaper Executive, 86
description: Charles Lee Reese Jr., former president of The News Journal Company in Wilmington, died of heart failure Wednesday at the retirment village where he lived in Hockessin, Del. He was 86 years old.

title: Queens Art Restorer Reports Robbery of 50 Works
description: An art restorer in Queens told the police yesterday that he was robbed of about 50 rare paintings and icons by 16th- and 17th- century European masters.

title: An Keats, Publisher and Editor, Dies at 73
description: An Keats, a book publisher and editor, died of pneumonia Sunday at Stamford (Conn.) Hospital. She was 73 years old and lived in New Canaan, Conn.

title: Columbia Laboratories reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
Shoney's in Pact
description: Shoney's Inc. said it had signed a three-year agreement to spend an estimated $90 million on recruitment and management training of minority members at more than 600 company-owned and operated restaurants. The company, which operates full-service and fast-food restaurants mostly in the Southeast, said it had also agreed to develop ''minority business relationships, expand minority franchisee ownership and participate in minority community service programs.'' The covenant with the Southern Christian Leadership Conference was signed by company officials at the close of the group's annual convention.

title: Woman Finds Pin in Cookies
description: A Long Island woman, Barbara Meiderdrut, found a straight pin in a package of Stripe Dainties cookies she bought today at a Pathmark supermarket here, the Nassau County police said. No one was injured. The store manager had other packages of the cookies removed. A Pathmark spokesman said the tampering appeared to be an isolated incident.

title: ANSWERS TO QUIZ
description: Questions appear on page 10.

description: b-Included an extraordinary credit of $1,454,000.

title: McGraw-Hill Stock Up $6
description: The shares of McGraw-Hill Inc. rose $6, to $85.50, yesterday in heavy trading on speculation about a possible takeover attempt by Paramount Communications Inc., which recently lost in an attempt to acquire Time Inc.

title: Forging a Yankee Legend One Afternoon in Boston
description: Anyone who wonders why there is a replica of Fenway Park's Green Monster at the Bucky Dent Baseball School in Delray Beach, Fla., must not have been a Yankee fan on Oct. 2, 1978.

title: Associated Communications reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
Josephine Palmer Voorhees, 94, Volunteer
description: Josephine Palmer Voorhees, long active in Brooklyn civic affairs and director of the Brooklyn Civilian Defense Volunteer office during World War II, died Wednesday at a nursing home in Alexandria, Va. She was 94 years old and had lived in Brooklyn Heights for 71 years until she became ill in 1987.

title: In Summer Dusk, Fargo Teen-Agers Revive Old Rite: Cruising
description: The cars turn onto Broadway in front of the First Lutheran Church, creeping bumper to bumper in the summer dusk, a seven-block-long, continuous loop of chrome and hot metal, thrumming mufflers and throbbing radios.

title: Consumer Prices Up 0.2% in July; Lessening of Inflation Risk Is See
description: The Consumer Price Index rose by two-tenths of 1 percent in July, as declines in gasoline and automobile prices largely offset increases for housing, the Labor Department reported today.

title: Alabama Man, 43, Is Executed For Killing Girl With Pipe Bomb
description: A murderer who was married in a prison ceremony last week was executed in Alabama's electric chair early today for the slaying of an 11-year-old girl.

title: BUSINESS DIGEST: SATURDAY, AUGUST 19, 1989
description: The Economy

title: Green Streets
description: It is truly wonderful what water can do for a city that's usually known as a concrete canyon.

title: Colombian Presidential Candidate Is Slain at Rally
description: A gunman assassinated a leading presidential hopeful at a political rally tonight, the mayor of Bogota said. It was the latest in a series of attacks tied to drug traffickers.

description: b-Included extraordinary gains of $13,321 for the quarter and $15,001 for the 6 months. c-Included an extraordinary charge of $7,000.

title: What Are They Waiting For?
description: New Yorkers wait on line a lot, probably more than any other Americans. They line up for buses, train tickets, the ladies' room at the theater, subway tokens, any and all events at Madison Square Garden, lottery tickets and the morning coffee-regular-with sugar and a cheese Danish.

title: AZT Maker Expected to Reap Big Gain
description: Favorable medical findings announced on Thursday will help AZT become one of the world's biggest-selling drugs, sharply improving the fortunes of Wellcome P.L.C., the British company that owns its manufacturer, drug industry analysts said yesterday.

title: A Step Solidarity Has to Take
description: All the players in Poland's political sweepstakes face this unnerving situation: The stakes are unimaginably high, the game has never been played before and no one knows the rules. And now Lech Walesa and his Solidarity colleagues are poised to make their most portentous move.

title: United Artists Entertainment Co. reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: Year-ago figures were not available. The company said interest and certain non-cash expenses relating to the recent merger with United Cable Television Corp. contributed to the loss. On May 25, United Artists Communications and United Cable Television were merged into a new entity, United Artists Entertainment. The results of operations for United Cable Television are included in United Artists Entertainment results from that date forward.

title: Man Admits Drug Trafficking
description: A 72-year-old man who formerly ran a political organization in Chinatown pleaded guilty yesterday to Federal drug-trafficking charges stemming from the seizure of more than 800 pounds of heroin earlier this year.

title: Prague Assails Polish Vote on '68 Invasion
description: Czechoslovakia today criticized a resolution passed by the Polish Parliament condemning the 1968 Soviet-led invasion.

title: Malfunction Sets Off a Siren At the Indian Point A-Plant
description: An overnight malfunction set off a warning siren at the Indian Point nuclear plant here, sending a high-pitched wail echoing through Westchester County for about 30 minutes, a Consolidated Edison spokeswoman said today.

title: Manfred Weichsel, Pediatrician, 85
description: Dr. Manfred Weichsel, a pediatrician and immunologist for more than 50 years, died of congestive heart failure Wednesday at Long Island Jewish Hospital in Queens. He was 85 years old.

title: Do It Yourself
description: Self-help books address themselves to the ambitions and anxieties of the moment, but in a way that personalizes them. There's no social malaise, these books seem to say, and no social solution either. Whether the answer is to make over your appearance, portfolio or personality, you can do it! And here's how!

title: F.D.A. to Toughen Generic Drug Oversight
description: In his first comprehensive response to disclosures of fraud and corruption in the regulation of generic drugs, the Secretary of Health and Human Services, Dr. Louis W. Sullivan, today announced a program of expanded inspections and administrative reforms.

title: General Sentenced in Liberia
description: A military court sentenced the former Defense Minister to death today for ordering the ritual slaying of a policeman as part of a plot to overthrow President Samuel Doe. Mr. Doe must approve the sentence against the former minister, Maj. Gen. Gray Allison.

title: Chops and Bacon Away!
description: In World War II an American hymn to bombing ended exultantly with the words, ''Nothing can stop the Army Air Corps!''

title: McDonald's Contract
description: Ben McDonald, the No. 1 pick in the June draft, has reached agreement on a contract with the Baltimore Orioles, his agent said last night.
